captions.text: Not that I want to sound like a professional ice cream taster complaining about a headache
But did we have a shorter drought period than usual I ask because my cup has been runnething over and it&#39;s been hard
to pick a review subject
I tried Borderlands 3, but I lost a little more will to live with every dialogue line
That was about nine times longer than it needed to be in the name of somehow eventually sounding witty possibly in accordance with the infinite
monkeys principle
Oh
and by the way at the risk of sounding unworked making
95% of your games characters hot badass ladies in tight pants and low-cut belly shirts is when you start to drift into the realms of
Fetishistic. I think that&#39;s called the sucker punch effect
I also tried out the surge too and blasphemous but frankly
I&#39;m holding off on the souls likes for a while until I offend mother again and need to sell flagellate
Then there are these two switch games. Everyone kept banging on at me to try who play the new Fire Emblem Yahtzee
It&#39;s really animate it so I did but I didn&#39;t really hate it
I just got bored of it the second time
I was obliged to run around an entire school patting every anime person on the head in turn like I was playing a game of
Tag that nobody else knew about so that left the other switch game astral chain
Which I did kind of get into and let&#39;s talk about that
It&#39;s still anime
But slightly more restrained with it in that I only noticed one character with visibly bouncing tits in the future of astral chain
Most of others have it&#39;s shit ruined by monsters from another dimension and the last remnants of humanity survive in a small isolated high tech
Nation, I feel like I&#39;ve seen this premise before in the animes
I wonder if Japan is trying to tell us something
Our character all characters we pick whether to play the male or female half of a pair of twins
But the only real difference it makes is whether or not we&#39;re allowed to wear hot pants are members of an elite police unit
who defend humanity from the interdimensional monsters through the use of time in two-dimensional monsters of their own permanently connected to their wrists by a
Chain of the astral variety so essentially it&#39;s a supercharged anime dog walking simulator
but if you&#39;re thinking the monsters with chains around their necks force to battle their own currents don&#39;t look super thrilled with the idea you
Might be right because after an inciting incident early on the pet monsters rebellion
Everyone loses theirs except to you you&#39;re special because the pet monsters respect your noble bearing and Keeble purchasing decisions
Astral chain comes to us from platinum games. Most recently known for near automata
but also responsible for Bayonetta and some other games with combat reminiscent of a handful of lit sparklers in a candy floss machine and as
Such you should expect fast combat high difficulty and every enemy monster being introduced to the freeze frame
profile like their characters in the Guy Ritchie film the central gimmick with this one is your little
Interdimensional pound puppy on a chain who you move around
independently with the second analog stick and it&#39;s quite an interesting gimmick as they go because you use the titular astral chain in combat as
A tripwire or to tie up enemies annoying as it always is when the right analog stick goes back and forth between controlling the camera
and something else because suddenly I can&#39;t use the camera to see where I&#39;m moving my murdered dog to in a crucial moment when I
Really need him to accurately sit on the paper. This was the game
That finally made me fork out for a switch pro controller, by the way
Because if I went through a hole platinum game with those tiny joy Khan analog nipples
My phalanges would have burst out the backs of my thumbs my little extruding surrender flags
Astral chains combat based around exotic yo-yoing techniques reminds me oddly of platinum zone the wonderful 101 the action of guiding genocide the wonder dog
around the ring
There isn&#39;t a million miles away from drawing circles and shapes for turn into weapons and the results can be just as fiddly and disappointing
as my flaccid attempt at straight lines wonderful 101
However was spectacularly over-the-top in the traditional rather than the magenta sense while astral chain comes off as somewhat more restrained restrained chains
This is all starting to sound a bit kinky, but no, it&#39;s the bad kind of restraint
Something seems to have happened to Platinum Games around the time. It was making near automata
these were the lads who brought us Bayonetta and Metal Gear Rising revengeance in which of a spectacled muscular senator power bombs the hero while
Lecturing him about his favorite neoconservative policies with a relish that stops just short of bursting into song, but Nier automata was somewhat muted
Tonally at least as far as any game with such lovingly rendered buttocks can be and I see a lot of its influence on astral
chain, especially the music
I was mentally back in Nier automata every time I went to the astral realm and heard the sound of distant choral voices singing a
Song inspired by a dial-up modem unlike Nier automata though astral train isn&#39;t really saying anything
Philosophically the setting story in characters will rather shallow bog standard anime stuff
Especially the monster design your leash top pedigree chums all look like Eva unit 01 knocked up Metal Gear Rex and some no doubt
Unimaginably destructive way and the one form that literally is supposed to be a dog looks exactly like the robot dog from revengeance
but without the
personality if anything is going to sell this game assuming you&#39;re not the kind of person who just buys anything with anime on it&#39;s because
You&#39;re convinced that this meaningful relationships with other human beings thing is a passing fad
It&#39;ll be the unique combat mechanics with your faithful ducky on a string shame
It&#39;s kind of buried amid so much other stuff like the one student in the school photo who ended up under a staple for one
thing it&#39;s possible to get by without it your dude or hot panted dudette can light attack heavy attack and dodge with the best of
them by themselves
So if anything going out of your way to bind the enemies as well
almost feels like overkill and this is only when you are in combat back when they were fun platinum would usually fully centralize their
Idiosyncratic high-octane combat, but now it seems we can&#39;t have our pudding till the eat our vegetables, too
There&#39;s also a focus on being respectable police officers exploring crime scenes gathering clues
Presenting the correct clue when asked in an anemic Phoenix rightie sort of way
There&#39;s a stealth section at one point that like all forced stilled in action games is about as welcome as a slug in a garden
Salad and about as much fun to get through a lot of side quests that throw you unexpectedly
Into incredibly banal minigames where you have to balance boxes do a sliding tile puzzle or hand out balloons
And then eventually you&#39;re allowed back into the astral realm for a bit of combat and a bit of platforming where your biggest threat is
Getting knocked off a ledge by your own fucking dope on a rope because you slightly misjudged the yank jump variety is nice
but this feels more like throwing a speed trap in front of my tires to delay me getting to the next interesting bit and even
With all this variety things start to feel a bit routine hang out at police HQ
Go to the city do some side quests go to the astral realm come back sandwiches
The astral realm is initially impressive if weirdly reminiscent of the one in control
But that&#39;s lost when you&#39;re in and out of it every five minutes like you&#39;re popping into the office over the weekend to pick up
Some files still routine sort of makes sense for a police game
Attention all officers a giant armored gorilla is flinging exploding turds around city centre
You mean a two two one eight?
No, it&#39;s a two two one nine because he&#39;s wearing a sombrero
